required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comprehensive Genetic Assessment, Risk and Education in a Mammography Pilot
clinical_study.official_title: Comprehensive Genetic Assessment, Risk and Education in a Mammography Pilot

brief_summary.textblock: Researchers are trying to learn more about the prevalence of genetic mutations in women who are at intermediate/high risk of breast cancer and how that information my assist providers in improving screening and preventative options.

primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects to have a pathogenic/likely pathogenic mutations (Positive test result on Proactive Cancer Screening Panel)
Number of subjects who decide to undergo genetic panel testing

clinical_study.condition: Women Age 35+ Qualifies if >15% Lifetime Risk of Breast Cancer as Defined by IBIS Version 8

arm_group.arm_group_label: Women at intermediate/high risk of breast cancer
arm_group.description: Women age 35 years old identified at intermediate/high risk of breast cancer will receive genetic testing

intervention.description: A blood draw or saliva kit will be provided to collect subject cells
intervention.arm_group_label: Women at intermediate/high risk of breast cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women participating in IRB:18-010601
- Aged 35 and over with a negative routine mammogram within 3 months.
- Qualifies as intermediate or high-risk (>15% lifetime risk of breast cancer as defined by IBIS version 8).
- Have an active email address for survey completion
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not participating in the Mayo Clinic CEDM pilot (IRB: 18-010601)
- Known genetic cancer syndrome with test results available for review in Mayo EMR
- Known breast cancer
- Unable to understand or sign informed consent
